intro: Marlimorimia pittieri, commonly known as the Brazilian moonflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique ecological role and limited distribution, making it a subject of conservation interest. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered, highlighting the need for protective measures.
